revised_title: Photometric Intensity of Coronal Light during the Solar Eclipse of 16th April, 1893
tldr: The authors measure the photometric intensity of the coronal light during the solar eclipse of 16th April, 1893, using methods similar to those employed in the 1886 eclipse. They find that the actual brightness of the corona was likely not very different between the two eclipses, and the slight apparent diminution observed in 1893 is probably due to air haze and sky illumination.
